Plants.commonDescription: Vallarai keerai or Gotu Kola (in Hindi) is a herb you must include in your child's diet. - It has the ability to relieve tension and anxiety
Plants.medicinaltips: Vallarai keerai is a panacea for human health, offering marvellous benefits for maintaining brain functions, heart health, lung, liver and kidney operations.

Plants.commonDescription: Sendi kodi appears to be a Malayalam word, which is a language spoken in the Indian state of Kerala. The term sendi kodi
Plants.medicinaltips: Sendi kodi leaves are dried and ground into very fine powder. It has a good aroma as the natural plant. It is 100% pure, natural and has no side effects. It can be used to cure the following disease

Plants.commonDescription: Bacopa monnieri (often called brahmi) is a botanical frequently used in Ayurvedic medicine
Plants.medicinaltips: Brahmi is known to have anticancer, antidiabetic, mitigating, antimicrobial and anti- oxidant and memory-enhancing properties.

Plants.commonDescription: Aloe is a cactus-like plant that grows in hot, dry climates. It is cultivated in subtropical regions around the world, including the southern border areas
Plants.medicinaltips: Aloe vera gel can be applied topically to treat acne, burns, radiation-induced skin toxicity, and other skin conditions.

Plants.commonDescription: Catharanthus is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. Like the genus Vinca, they are known commonly as periwinkles.
Plants.medicinaltips: Cancer: The plant is a source of the drugs vincristine and vinblastine, which are used to treat cancer.

Plants.commonDescription: The bael tree is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to India. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 9 meters tall
Plants.medicinaltips: Antidiabetic, Hypolipidemic, Anti-inflammatory, Antioxidant, Wound healing, Antipyretic potential, Antidiarrheal activity, Diuretic activity, and Ulcer healing.

Plants.commonDescription: Operculina turpethum (syn. Ipomoea turpethum) is a species of plant in the morning glory family, known commonly as turpeth, fue vao, and St. Thomas lidpod.
Plants.medicinaltips: Ailments like fever, edema, asthma, hemorrhoids, dyspepsia, flatulence, gout, paralysis, abdominal tumors, and worm infestation

Plants.commonDescription: Asthma sufferers use the leaves and roots of S. auriculata. Patients with diabetes, congestion, and bladder infections use the tea Kalpa
Plants.medicinaltips: The root is used in decoctions against fevers, diabetes, diseases of urinary system and constipation.
